text: this high-speed ferry was traveling from
Macau on the Chinese mainland to Hong
Kong when it hits something in the water
it's not clear what the object was but
the damage it caused was serious there
were a hundred and sixty three
passengers and 11 crew on board and
according to the Hong Kong authorities
more than 120 people were injured five
of them critically when the injured
arrived at appear they were taken to
waiting ambulances and then to hospital
for treatment local media reported
passengers describing chaotic scenes on
board as the boat took on water it
happened on Sunday evening local time
after the collision near Lantau Island
the boat lost power the waters around
Hong Kong are increasingly busy with
fairies taking tourists to and from
Macau the only city in China where
gambling is allowed there have been
other serious accidents like this an
investigation will now begin into the
cause of this latest one Bend land BBC
News
